website_summaries.verdict: The Brother QL-820NWB is a feature-rich label maker capable of churning out professional-looking output quickly and efficiently.
pros: Multiple network and mobile connectivity options
Great print software and mobile app
Operates as standalone label maker and printer with optional battery
cons: Consumables somewhat costly on a per-label basis
Ability to print in red limited to one label type

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for Check-in Stations and Name Tags!
customer_reviews.text: Works very well for our church check-in stations using iPads. They are very easy to setup and work great. The printing is less bold than on Dymo. DO NOT use the sample labels on something you want to remove the label from or damage will occur. For name tags, use these labels:
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Breeze to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: I own the Brother QL-720NW, decided to try the new QL-820NWB. Very glad I did. This new label printer is a great upgrade. It is easy to setup and use. The on screen LCD and menu system makes connections to various devices a snap. No hitch connecting my android smartphone or my apple ipad using bluetooth. Reading some earlier comments, I was prepared for some troubles. I found none, none whatesoever. I also purchased the optional battery, which makes labeling boxes down in the basement a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: J. Y.

customer_reviews.title: AutoCut does not work when printing multiple labels
customer_reviews.text: I use this to print badges for conferences. We use the clear DK2113 clear labels which are very expensive compared to the white paper adhesive labels. This printer is VERY fast and the print quality is excellent. My only complaint is that this one particular machine will not cut between the labels when we print multiple badges at a time. I have another 820NWB (as well as QL800) which does cut between the labels. I have checked multiple times to ensure that auto cut is on and compared settings and they are set up the same so it must be this particular printer. Other than that it is a great printer.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Little Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: MY old P-Touch died and I replaced it with this versatile, fast, label printer from Brother. Looked at the entire line and discarded the other models in the line settling on this version. I have it connected over bluetooth rather than wirelessly, but my wife borrows it and uses it wireless for her classroom needs. It is fast, convenient and sturdy. It automatically reads the size tapes installed as a final check before printing. Saved me a few times since my wife installed a different size for her uses and I was unaware of the change. I have not found any blank tapes that have not worked in it, but I am purchasing only compatible tapes to save the expense.
customer_reviews.author: John A.A. Opiola

customer_reviews.title: One or the other, but not without reinstalling software
customer_reviews.text: Network/Wireless but not both. In order to have the 720NW work as a Network Printer (works great) you need to set it up as a wired network unit. If you want it to work as a wireless printer, per Brother, you would have to reset the network card in the printer for wireless and then it will work, when you are ready to go back to wired, you will need to reset it again. I have owned the 500, 550 and now the 720NW, with small internal changes, all of these units operate about the same. User manual translation is OK, but you may have to re-read certain areas.
customer_reviews.author: amarevw

customer_reviews.title: It's solid
customer_reviews.text: I have this set up to work wirelessly with my computer and Bluetooth with my iPhone. Works Great. I can easily make labels of icons I save to my phone. I'm using the P-Touch label editor, which isn't great. I wish there was an easier, more productive app for this. So, I've created a correct size print template for a mailing label and I copy and paste the info that I need for a mailing label... pretty easy.
customer_reviews.author: R. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Easily pairs wirelessly with iPad visitor kiosk at our office
customer_reviews.text: This label printer was purchased to be used exclusively with our office kiosk for visitor name badges. The printer was super easy to set up and pair with an iPad via Bluetooth. The label rolls feed easily and the print quality is as expected. The label printer has been in regular use for over 1 year and had not had any issues thus far. Overall, a great printer.
customer_reviews.author: PharmaGuy

customer_reviews.title: Love it so much I bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: I love this networked printer so much that I purchased a USB version too. My boss and I share the networked version for printing address labels, and the USB version is attached to my PC only so I can print file folder labels. I bought two because swapping the tapes is a little bit of a PITA if you switch label sizes frequently.
customer_reviews.author: LisaB

customer_reviews.title: Works Well, Tricky Setup for Mobile Printing
customer_reviews.text: It really was a pain to get set up for printing eBay shipping labels. Their tech support isn't good. Once you get it working, it works great. For anyone looking to work with this for eBay shipping labels you'll need to set up the formatting through a laptop first before you can print from a mobile device like a tablet. Once you have the formatting set up through a laptop you can print in the right format through mobile devices using the eBay app which is great!
customer_reviews.author: Taylre Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, bulkier than you’d think
customer_reviews.text: Docking one star for the size, this thing is huge. The OEM red-black labels are costly, but third-party black-only rolls are inexpensive. Unlike Dymo printers, swapping rolls is easy as the feed doesn’t grip the paper. The continuous rolls mean less waste, and you can make quite long banners if you want to. The software for iOS and MacOS takes some getting used to, but is functional and I love the QR code support.
customer_reviews.author: Fazal Majid

customer_reviews.title: you can put it on a tupperware lid and it will easily remove when it's time to empty the container)
customer_reviews.text: I use this label maker for almost EVERYTHING! I label canned fruits and vegetables, frozen foods, identify tupperware in the fridge (if you fold just a little bit back from each end of a standard label, you can put it on a tupperware lid and it will easily remove when it's time to empty the container). Bins of various parts and tools in the garage, boxes that are packed in the attic, old files, and so on. The Brother iPrint software works seamlessly from your cell phone, and you can print from anywhere in your house, from any computing device if you have a wireless network.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Golub

customer_reviews.title: its pretty good. Prints quickly and cleanly
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a printer that is not used with wifi at different locations, its pretty good. Prints quickly and cleanly. Software it pretty old school, but it functions. However, I needed to use it at different locations and different wifi settings, and it took myself, the IT rep, and the Brother Support call center an hour together to switch the wifi from one place to another. Also, their mobile device is much weaker and limited. Useless for what I needed it for, but when wired into a computer, it does fine.
customer_reviews.author: MelBergInk

customer_reviews.title: Print Labels from your iPhone!
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered I thought being able to print labels from my iPhone would be a gimmicky feature. But let me tell you, that's practically the only way I print labels now! Within a few clicks of the phone I can print a custom address label. The hardest part is making sure I put the right size label material in the printer. Which they had a better way to change labels in and out like my little handheld labeler with the P-Touch tapes.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Dorsett

customer_reviews.title: They work great, but print quality bleeds
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic. I use them to make labels for my hard drives with project info. Though the labels it comes with has this red hue to the print, it bleeds into the black.
customer_reviews.author: Willis Chung

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Love this little printer!! Took a little know how to figure out connection, but was able to decode things pretty easily. Prints quickly, works with my shipping program (pirateship) and I anticipate this will be a wonderful asset to my homebased business. One thing I do wish was identified on the description is that the rechargeable battery is MOT included. (Extra $99 is a separate purchase)
customer_reviews.author: Susan L.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer was well worth the money. I bought several different rolls of labels and have been just pummeling it since it showed up. It works well, it's fast, and it's really quiet. I work with a lot of files, mailings, etc. in my job and this thing is a sweet unit. I highly recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: CrankyNVGuy

customer_reviews.title: Prints well, good idea
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of feeding envelopes into my printers. This device is well designed and prints well. Comes with software for easy label printing and designing labels. I gave it four stars because the installation has a bug in how it setup on the wireless network. It refused to print until I called tech support to go through the settings. This could be relevant to my system only so please don't expect that to happen for everyone. Their support is American based, friendly and experienced.
customer_reviews.author: agoshopper

customer_reviews.title: perfect labels
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my office and been using it for about 3 months and it has worked good! We had to open it up and remove a piece of label/adhesive but other than that it’s great!
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware if you buy competitor rolls of labels to save money on labels.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous system except you can't re-use the roll frames. So you must buy the more expensive rolls from Brother. I don't think it is cost effective due to these failures in design. I would not purchase this know what I discovered the hard way.
customer_reviews.author: WB

customer_reviews.title: Works great for barcodes.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to make barcodes for my business and the printer did a great job. it's very fast and automatically cuts the paper after printing.
customer_reviews.author: philip

customer_reviews.title: Cool, but don't call support.
customer_reviews.text: Product is great but Brother's support was horrible. After spending an hour on hold and listening to the rep read his script, I told the rep that after 20 years in IT, we can skip the script and get to the true issue. I even told him how to solve the problem, just needed his assistance with how the unit installs the driver port for the wireless configuration. I go on hold....because it's not on his script. After 20 more minutes (and 1.5 hours of trial and error while on this call now) I solved the problem myself without support. It's a cool printer, but unless you know IT...don't plan on using the wireless network connection.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Seelinger

customer_reviews.title: Had to return it
customer_reviews.text: I received a unit that was defective. I needed it to be used with Bluetooth, but the connection was unstable and kept dropping.
customer_reviews.author: NasMas Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Software is the worst.
customer_reviews.text: Software is so bad that the printer is not useable. You truly have to experience trying to use the software just to understand how bad it is. Printer may be fine but software makes it impossible to print anything useful. You have been warned.
customer_reviews.author: Dan in NJ

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to use.
customer_reviews.text: Always gives errors. Prints one label, then says the next one is out of paper or wrong paper type. I'm sorry I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work As Well As It Should
customer_reviews.text: When this label printer works, it creates nice labels. However, this printer would be great if it didn't go OFFLINE so much! What an aggravation this has been. The Brother label making software also has problems communicating with this label printer. I need to contact Brother tech support to find out how to resolve these issues. I even called their tech support BEFORE I bought it to make sure that the software and wireless capabilities work well. They said yes. Ha, right!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compatible with Clover
customer_reviews.text: Compatible with Clover AND WORKED GREAT. EASY TO INSTALL LABELS
customer_reviews.author: Izzie Rose

customer_reviews.title: Good printer, mediocre iPhone app
customer_reviews.text: The printer works well, it is moderately easy to install the labels. Update: I did figure out how to edit a label in the app, so 3=>4 stars. Not the most intuitive app, however.
customer_reviews.author: dsw

customer_reviews.title: Poor as wireless, excellent with USB connection
customer_reviews.text: I bought this label printer for the wireless capability. after a month, I can't connect the printer to the network so that my laptop and devices can see it as an available printer. But, if you connect to a USB cable, the printer is excellent, and the software is also very easy to use. for USB connection ***** five stars for Wireless connection no star Thus my rating .. .
customer_reviews.author: CAthlete

customer_reviews.title: Does not work. A waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This machine is terrible. It has never worked consistently. It loses sync with my devices and customer service is awlful. Find another company to get a label printer from.
customer_reviews.author: Jamelle McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Label the world!
customer_reviews.text: People that like to label everything on Earth will love this printer. Small, easy to handle, no ribbon to have to hassle with. Can network or USB connect. Software is pretty good that works with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality, New and unopened
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Quality, New and unopened! Works great!! Super fast printing on all size labels and the software is pretty awesome! I would download the newest version from Brother's website it has Lots of cool and customization features!! I Highly Recommend anything Brother makes! You can almost always bet it is of highest quality! A+++
customer_reviews.author: Lance B.

customer_reviews.title: just want I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I am updating my home office and wanted to have a printer that I could do address labels on. There are a few options, but I chose the DL720NW because I wanted a networked printer. If your looking to the manual to help with understanding what to do, forget it. (this is why it's four, not 5 stars). Otherwise, once I got on the web and learned a couple of things, set up was simple, software was easy enough and all is well. I'm in a both MAC & Windows environment; no issues with either. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Ghigliotty

customer_reviews.title: The printers print clearly, but are extremely slow. ...
customer_reviews.text: The printers print clearly, but are extremely slow. I wanted them for a children's check in system, speed is very important. I think I could hand write a name tag almost as fast as these printers print.
customer_reviews.author: ladboy

customer_reviews.title: Works first time, Easy install...
customer_reviews.text: We installed these printers for our Visitor Care Centre, and they worked the first time. They were the easiest part of the install. Highly recomended...
customer_reviews.author: Rob Steyn

customer_reviews.title: Great label printer
customer_reviews.text: This label printer is fantastic. A great upgrade from the previous model as it has wifi built in, making placement nice and simple. Configuring it with the included CD was very simple. There are LOTS of label sizes and options for you. BEST PART*** You can use your iOS devices to print labels. It's SUPER easy to do. I highly recommend this label maker and I would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: game changer
customer_reviews.text: This product is totally worth it. It has substantially sped up the amount of time we spend sending out mail. We have it by our mail station, but anyone in the office can print to it. So you can print your label, and then go to the mail station and it is waiting for you. This is just faster than printing to an envelope because you never have to think about what type of envelope you are using.
customer_reviews.author: Soren G. Brockdorf

customer_reviews.title: Been working great for 6 months now with my Macs
customer_reviews.text: Been working great for 6 months now with my Macs. Print to it wireless. I use the continuous label paper spools and then have machine cut to size I need for label.
customer_reviews.author: D. Patridge

customer_reviews.title: Like magic...
customer_reviews.text: This thing quickly prints our badges out with minimal effort and cost. I'm glad I selected this model. I have one printing from both a PC and nearby iPads without issue.
customer_reviews.author: oneaustin

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to connect and configure with an Ipad! Printing quality could be better.
customer_reviews.author: LuisV PR

customer_reviews.title: Bang for Buck
customer_reviews.text: Great labeler for the price. NOT a UPS or Fedex labeler. We use in a manufacturing shop and it serves as our incoming ID labeler. Can buy different label sizes up to about 4". Highly recommend brother labelers. Hardline or wireless.
customer_reviews.author: drum_24

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it the amazon fire or this but the connection between them doesn’t work consistently
customer_reviews.author: Jay Morris

customer_reviews.title: Great quality at this price point
customer_reviews.text: We are using this to print visitor badges, including a photo of the visitor's face. So far, the only issue is that when it loses power (unplugged or power failure), we have to manually turn the wifi back on. Price was great. It is super simple to load labels.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara L Powell

customer_reviews.title: It's a great label printer I can't live without It now at ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a great label printer I can't live without It now at first it was giving me problem to make it wireless I called brother they helped me set it up. I like the fact that I set it up with my clover point of sale and it prints out price labels to be scanned Perfect to any small business. A must I add
customer_reviews.author: Linda Morrar

customer_reviews.title: this is a lot better.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to test if the QL-810W that I purchase recently or the label file has issue. Outcome: QL810W is trash, this is a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great device and I use it every day. The desktop version of the app to print from is a bit difficult to operate. I found The right mobile app and it's super user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Koko Paulli

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t even turn on
customer_reviews.text: Product came fast but we weren’t able to use it because it doesn’t even turn on. We returned it and we’ll buy new one.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Baker

customer_reviews.title: It prints well, however it was very difficult to ...
customer_reviews.text: It prints well, however it was very difficult to setup. Had to download the instructions. That is the reason for the 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Shopping

customer_reviews.title: Best label printer I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: The Brother QL-720NW professional label printer is a great deal for the money. It is easy to set up and easy to use. You can set the printer to print large quantities of labels and leave the room and come back and they are done. There are also multiple size labels to choose from that fit this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Deitering

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last very long
customer_reviews.text: We bought this printer and had to replace it within a year - bought another one and it lasted even less time. See that they're not making them anymore. Good move as it is not a workhorse.
customer_reviews.author: Cheer Mom

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: It often disconnects from the network on its own but otherwise its good. Ink cartridge doesn’t last long....
customer_reviews.author: Carter

customer_reviews.title: Slick
customer_reviews.text: Unit was alittle difficult to set up using WiFI. Prints very fast. Software is not compatable with 64 bit office and rearraging the layout of a lable for printing leaves a lot to be desired. I still have not found an easy way to get the Co name to print first and then the persons name.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest D. Bliss

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Label Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer is an excellent tool for your office or any project. Use Bluetooth, Wifi, Ethernet, actually it prints from anywhere. The only drawback is the limited supplies available.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson Santos

customer_reviews.title: Poor print quality, wastes product
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to make many small labels but the print quality was poor when printing very small font, the layout options were limited, and we were bummed at how much material was wasted. Back it goes.
customer_reviews.author: MamaS

customer_reviews.title: If you have an Apple computer, I'd stay away
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap this thing was difficult to set up on my Macbook. I am very tech savvy. Instructions made my head spin. Once I finally did get it set up, the steps needed to use it were pain staking. Finally gave up and sent it back. Wouldn't recommend it for anyone with an Apple computer.
customer_reviews.author: Willie S.

customer_reviews.title: great space saving label printer and the best part is ...
customer_reviews.text: great space saving label printer and the best part is it's wireless. we have one networked in our office and everyone from all the computers can print to it. we've even printed from our smartphones from the app which is easy to use and it comes with numerous templates. we've had it for about two years and it's still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: TechnoNerdTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: It's easy to get over heat after about 40 label printed.
customer_reviews.text: I usually print DK1202 and DK1208 a lot. When I print DK1202 continuously it start stop 3 second after 40-45 label printed. First it stop every 5th label printing and soon it stops every 3rd label printing and over over again. Other than that it's good label printer.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great label printer. We have it networked in our office with about 6 users. Makes file labeling clean and neat. Pushed out a template with company logo to all users, now all of our files have consistent labeling. No more hand written labels. Many different size labels available to fit many needs.
customer_reviews.author: SouthAL88

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Looks like the heating element is dead. The labels come out empty. Had to replace this printer with a backup that we had.
customer_reviews.author: ethaniel

customer_reviews.title: They work great. Using them with Ipads
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 5 of these. They work great. Using them with Ipads.
customer_reviews.author: NewLife

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy to use thermal printer
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as described. Easy to set up. Connected to a mobile device very quickly. Print quality is more than sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: JGittes

customer_reviews.title: Great label printer
customer_reviews.text: I only wish I had bought this printer much sooner but I wasn't sure if I could justify having this when I would only be using it occasionally in my home office. It's so convenient to be able to quickly print file folder labels and have the machine automatically cut them one by one. Now I wonder how I ever lived without it.
customer_reviews.author: G. Tomlinson

customer_reviews.title: Very good working label printer
customer_reviews.text: Very quick and good working network label printer. Good quality and also automatic cuts the label. Can only suggest it if you often print labels.
customer_reviews.author: Susanna

customer_reviews.title: Maybe for you not me
customer_reviews.text: We got this printer for the interim of having IDs for staff, it was easy to configure but the print quality is not up to par for what we need it for
customer_reviews.author: WindhamSD

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to use. Set would be easier if set up disk included print drivers on the disk. When I went to set up on other computers on my network I had to pick a printer similar to QL-720NW. This took several tries to get a device that would work.
customer_reviews.author: S T Haer

customer_reviews.title: Brother always-720nw label printer
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an older unit I had that wasn't wireless. This works just like my old one without any flaws. Very satisfied. Easy to change labels.
customer_reviews.author: Thom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up & use!
customer_reviews.text: So glad to have the bluetooth feature. Turned it on & synced with an iPad...works wonderfully!
customer_reviews.author: Allison B

customer_reviews.title: Solid label printer
customer_reviews.text: I constantly use this at work with no issues! Great label printer. I have had this for a few years now.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great for office use
customer_reviews.text: My entire office loves this. We were still typing labels the old fashion way. 12 people all print to the machine and it was super easy to set up. I'm not a network specialist by any stretch and I got it to work the 1st time!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A Pugh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great is used for product ingredient labels. Was easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl taylor Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little printer that I absolutely don't understand yet. I am sure with time I will figure out the other functions, but for what I needed immediately- labels- it was up and running in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great label printer
customer_reviews.text: I hooked this printer up as a network printr in my office and put it in a central location. It is being used by 8 people and they all love it. The software is easy to use for all kinds of labels from file folders to mailing labels
customer_reviews.author: Walt Keeney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: The included software works very well allowing user to customize labels. I've had it about one month, so I can't speak about reliability yet. If it stays functional then this is a great tool. When a print job is sent to the printer, the printer responds very quickly
customer_reviews.author: JetJocky

customer_reviews.title: Don’t care for it at all
customer_reviews.text: Not user friendly at all, unable to copy from my contacts where it comes out looking accurate at all. Ready to send it back, very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Jose R. Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Printer already having issues pulling in lables for printing. Not even six months old.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT IOs compatible, NOT wifi compatible
customer_reviews.text: FALSELY ADVERTISED!!!! Does not work with IPad or on Wifi. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer, but bluetooth printing is slow to print from mobile devices
customer_reviews.text: Be careful with this printer - especially if you’re using with an iPad! It takes 5 seconds to queue a 2.5 x 4 label over bluetooth. WiFi is much faster!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Smith

customer_reviews.title: As described, fast ship - remember most label printers ...
customer_reviews.text: As described, fast ship - remember most label printers are designed to print from their own software rather than yours......
customer_reviews.author: tg

customer_reviews.title: Not wireless unless you buy a battery
customer_reviews.text: It's only wireless if you buy a separate battery. Product description is mis-leading.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer
customer_reviews.text: This is great for printing name tags for work events
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: absolute pos
customer_reviews.text: worked great for a couple weeks. now it is unresponsive to network scans. flashes red whenever we send it job. applications that came with the printer crash. the reset procedure does not work. printer is now a $120 brick.
customer_reviews.author: William Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: worked for 2 month good. then was giving trouble
customer_reviews.text: worked for 2 month good. then was giving trouble. now doesn't work and company tried trouble shooting it for us and they said it's defective printer.
customer_reviews.author: Irina Kulik

customer_reviews.title: I do like the paper because it does not require ink
customer_reviews.text: It's not a gem. It does not make my life any easier. The settings are crippled and it is hard to imagine this staying on the market much longer. I do like the paper because it does not require ink.
customer_reviews.author: KiDS NEED MORE

customer_reviews.title: We quick and works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This little device is very handy for our travel ministry. We quick and works like a charm, I only wish the CD label I use in it was cheaper. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kingdom Focus

customer_reviews.title: I can run good readable labels at a resonable price
customer_reviews.text: I have a hard time writing readable english. I can run good readable labels at a resonable price . Very simple to use.Even for a guy bad at all this stuf.
customer_reviews.author: Lowery Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best label printer I ever own!
customer_reviews.text: This simply is very convenient compact and time saving machine !!! Couldn't be happier !!!
customer_reviews.author: budiuman

customer_reviews.title: Brothers QL-720NW
customer_reviews.text: Product works as seller described I own 2 of these printers very nice product.
customer_reviews.author: sandman

customer_reviews.title: printer didn't last very long, bad service from Brother
customer_reviews.text: The printer didn't hold up very well. BROTHER DOESN'T HONOR THEIR WARRANTY. I spent an hour on the phone with them after the printer stopped working, they escalated the problem - which just meant they wanted to get off the phone. It was several days before the 'escalated' person returned my call. They still won't do anything to fix it. There was no particular reason to escalate anything, the printer just broke. Disappointing that the printer broke so soon and crappy service from Brother means my rating changed from 4 stars to 1.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Heim

customer_reviews.title: This works well.
customer_reviews.text: I recommend. This fot the bill. NO problems. Worked with multiple computers with little setup and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Gary White

customer_reviews.title: Fast little printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a fast little printer. I only use it right now with the USB cable and not with the wireless or Ethernet as of yet. I did buy this over the Dymo label makers because this printed faster and had a wireless/Ethernet connection.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing! The software is not good and not very user-friendly. I was never able to get it to print and I ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Carmela Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Use WiFi if you don't want a headake
customer_reviews.text: If you use Ethernet you must have technology knowledge to be able to set it up. It took me awhile to set up but i got it
customer_reviews.author: Gabe Martineau

customer_reviews.title: does  not work
customer_reviews.text: annoying cost so much but chaotic instructions . will be returning
customer_reviews.author: terron richardson

customer_reviews.title: Super recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the 2nd time. I have now two of these and it work very well. Super recommended.
customer_reviews.author: jimbaran

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping and accurate
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that need to change is the Power Adapter type.
customer_reviews.author: Girish SUMBHOO

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for home office, small business shipping and labeling needs. Easy to install over wireless - a snap.
customer_reviews.author: Summer Rain

customer_reviews.title: Product never worked and I still haven't heard back as ...
customer_reviews.text: Product never worked and I still haven't heard back as to how I can return it. First time I have had this happen...hope its the last
customer_reviews.author: Lee Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great value and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great value for a network enable label printer. There are 10 of us in the office and this is easy to use. It was a bit time consuming to set up initially, but after the first install it went quickly. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: dna7575

customer_reviews.title: Labels quit feeding
customer_reviews.text: Labels quit feeding within one month of purchase. We have tried cleaning it,using official Brother labels, aftermarket labels, and other things and it just won't work.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Fast

customer_reviews.title: Just right.
customer_reviews.text: I use my smaller brother p-touch label maker all the time but I needed something for larger projects. I looked at both Brother and the Dymo range. Having used lots of Brother printers in the past and had very few problems I went with this. I have not been disappointed. It was easy to set up, sits on the wireless network without problems, the drop in labels are really simple. I use this for file folders, address labels and it is always there when I need it. Printing is super fast. Software is okay (using Windows 8) does what I need it to do and doesn't get in my way. I really like this device and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: marshmania

customer_reviews.title: Time saver
customer_reviews.text: This is much easier than trying to set up a laser printer, especially for printing single labels. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: VG

product_meta.title: Brother QL-820NWB Professional, Ultra Flexible Label Printer with Multiple Connectivity options
product_meta.description: Create amazing black/Red labels using DK 2251 or cost effective, paper labels for packages, name badges, postage* and more. Ultra fast, printing up to 110 standard address labels per minute with black text at 300dpi. Easy to read monochrome LCD screen allows for standalone use. Create and print labels from your mobile device when connected to a wireless network. Add an optional li ion battery for a complete mobile solution. Easy to integrate with free software development kits (windows, iOS and Android). Convenient, Brother DK drop in labeling supplies. No ink or toner needed. Windows and Mac compatible.
feature_bullets: Flexible connectivity the QL 820NWB network label printer features Bluetooth wireless technology, Ethernet and Wireless (802.11B/g/N) interfaces
Also offers a USB host interface for use with a peripheral such as a Scanner
Ultra fast, up to 110 standard address labels per minute with black text at 300dpi
Easy to read monochrome LCD screen allows for standalone use
Print amazing black/red labels using DK 2251; Maximum Label Length: 3 feet
